name: 5-bromo-2-nitropyridine
Reason: 5-bromo-2-nitropyridine has a basic unit of pyridine, which has a melting point of around 100°C. The bromine atom increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the potential for hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +20°C. The nitro group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +10°C.
